body:
@ashb I updated PR. 
Should I change the class names for elements related to the legend on non-BEM versions?
@Fokko Thanks.
@Fokko I rebase on master, PTAL, thanks.

> BTW, In this sensors, We push some data to XCom, So should we change the sensors name and add some word like `subscribe` or `push`, just like https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/afa06aefa5e0d70836bd11c0116ef3c1d2db4fc3/tests/contrib/sensors/test_redis_pub_sub_sensor.py
> 
> I have this idea due to most of are check if in some specific state but this is not. WDYT?

@mans2singh  I not familiar with with AWS, but I think sensor is check untill specific state exists. But this sensor check and push some information to Xcom, So I come out with this idea.

Maybe we should left that to committer to discuss.
@Fokko I already add `[ci skip]` in the git comment.
@zhongjiajie - I've corrected to use conn rather the hook in the poke method. Thanks again for your help.

Ok, will review and update repo shortly.

Automated tests — cannot promise that I can do it anytime soon :(

On Sun, Mar 24, 2019 at 5:09 AM Kamil Breguła <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I have a suggestion. To add it to your repository execute a command:
>
> curl https://termbin.com/wymk | git am
>
> Can you also add automatic tests?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4891#issuecomment-475924128>, or mute
> the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAIAcmfzm7-Fch6VsEJ3AyYRE5QuDsO2ks5vZuxhgaJpZM4bnTS4>
> .
>

Unit tests are needed only. 
Example: 
https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/tests/contrib/operators/test_gcp_translate_operator.py
https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/tests/contrib/hooks/test_gcp_translate_hook.py

Will look into it but quite limited in time right now and already spent on
that contrib way more time than I've planned.

On Sun, Mar 24, 2019 at 11:53 AM Kamil Breguła <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Unit tests are needed only.
> Example:
>
> https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/master/tests/contrib/operators/test_gcp_translate_operator.py
>

@zhongjiajie This causes test failures due to invalid docs. Turns out CI skip was a bad idea on docs, at least in this case :D

We can have this back once the test pass :)

I edited  the docs a bit directly on your branch to improve the English a bit (some of the tenses and plurals were a bit wrong) and to update the instructions about setting up the hook: https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4895/commits/19133bcdfa9da4d981bba811855d2f84df54b473

(We don't need to set the host anymore do we?)
@ashb I am so sorry about that. I will fix that.
BTW, I am trying improve my English recently :sob:

> so I think we should let user know their could manual pass host to connection. WDYT?

Sounds good.
From https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4897, sorry for break our CI test in https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4897

> > so I think we should let user know their could manual pass host to connection. WDYT?
> 
> Sounds good.

So should I revert describe in https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/4895/files#diff-a46bd26d7b5231c209f6fa37d2622cc5R29 to tell user could pass `host` to connection?

Not revert, but say   something like "if you need to change the host used you can set the host field of the connection". (Most people wont need to do this, so the docs shouldn't imply its a required step)
I update this PR, PTAL, Thanks.

CI doc check pass, but failed in main test. https://travis-ci.org/apache/airflow/builds/510600306?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification
Maybe I should force push to restart CI?

```sh
======================================================================
57) FAIL: test_dagrun_root_after_dagrun_unfinished (tests.test_jobs.SchedulerJobTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
   Traceback (most recent call last):
    tests/test_jobs.py line 2556 in test_dagrun_root_after_dagrun_unfinished
      self.assertEqual(first_run.state, State.SUCCESS)
   AssertionError: u'running' != u'success'
   - running
   + success
```
I find out our master branch ci failed due to this PR merge yesterday, And I have to go to bed because is mid-night in my zone. Maybe someone could take a look?

@Fokko @feng-tao

@zhongjiajie - Thanks for your feedback and advice.
@feng-tao and team - let me know if there is any additional recommendations.  Thanks
I updated a PR.
@ashb @Fokko -> I've just added a very nice and easy to setup auto-complete for breee command :). It's becoming a really useful piece of software. Also I am down to just 8 errors in Travis CI.
will take a look
PTAL @Fokko @kaxil @XD-DENG

@feng-tao I am working on the kerberos authentication. I'm having a lot of trouble setting up the kerberos environment locally, so I can debug my builds. If you have experience with kerberos, it would be much appreciated to help on the kerberos failures in the test cases.
@zingorn would you be able to make the changes suggested?

> @zingorn would you be able to make the changes suggested?

sure

@Fokko / @kaxil - xcom is done a little differently in the pod launcher. 
`if PodLauncher.extract_xcom == True` : it spins up both the user's container AND a sidecar container. they both share a volume with each other. see:
https://github.com/apache/airflow/blob/cf934be127206d2d75dce49f1fb0b2c2ffcdcb63/airflow/contrib/kubernetes/kubernetes_request_factory/pod_request_factory.py#L73

for xcom to work, the user's container has to manually write to the file `/airflow/xcom/return.json` before it finishes
i dont think we should force the use of the sidecar
@ashb CI failed several times, and it's unrelated. This PR just change docs and log so I think it could be merge.
Awesome @feng-tao
@ashb Thanks.
This PR is failing because of Flake8 style violations.
Sorry I messed up trying to re-base your branch. I didn't mean to close this.

@ashb @fokko -> as a follow up I also implemented auto-complete for "run-test" method inside the container. 

This was by far the single biggest problem I had when running the tests. Having to remember module names and the : in the right place was a major pain. Now it's super convenient to start typing the module name and use auto-complete. It goes down to individual tests.

I also renamed and shortened the run_unit_test.sh method to simple 'run-test' that you can run anywhere (it is in the path). I also added --skip-db-init flag - most of the tests do not require to re-run the database initialisation and if you want to re-run single test, it takes awfully lot of time. So you can now pass --skip-db-init flag to skip resetdb/initdb. You can even autocomplete it ;). 

I think with those changes, life of developers trying to use breeze/replicate CI tests will be much, much easier.

I used nosetests for now but we can do very similar thing with pytest when we switch to it.
I wondered why this view doesn't refresh automatically. I hope someone will continue the work done on this PR
Ready for review when you have time @ashb @mik-laj. This resolves one last span that should be an anchor that I missed in my previous patch.

@XD-DENG  Thank you for your helpful comments and for taking the time to point out options to
improve this PR.

@ashb PTAL,
CI failed unrelated, it passed in my fork https://travis-ci.com/zhongjiajie/airflow/builds/105652590?utm_medium=notification&utm_source=email

@ashb I found out you make jira ticket status "RESOLVED", It nessary for me to change jira ticket when PR was merge? Ask that because I found out them will change status auto when related PR be merge.

@bryanyang0528 You're welcome ;-)

Thanks for your contribution as well.

The commiter usually marks the Jira ticket as resolved, but we forget sometimes. If we don't,  yes you can mark your own Jira tickets as resolved. If you do please also set the Fix Version field - to 2.0.0 or 1.10.3 depending on if it's a large/backwards-incompatible change or not.
@ashb -> thanks for the thorough review. I will apply all the comments shortly
LGTM
I got it, thanks @ashb
@Fokko  Done
cc @milton0825
cc @feng-tao
👍 thanks for the fix
@ashb @XD-DENG I've made all recommended changes (hopefully). PTAL.
@XD-DENG - I've updated the test based on your feedback.  Please let me know if you have any additional advice.  Thanks
@Fokko I updated a PR: http://steadfast-machine.surge.sh/howto/operator/index.html
why does it fail for all the python27 CI?

@ashb I've rebase Your changes.
Thanks - if I was paying more attention I could have merged it (and squashed it) on Github. The reason Why I changed it from `__` to `_` is that `__` is generally reserved for Python internals.

For me  `__` always meant private (because it cannot be overwritten), and `_` protected (because it can be overwritten). Mostly because of this:
https://docs.python.org/3.7/tutorial/classes.html#private-variables

But I get Your point, I think this is just part of preference, how to think about API design.
Oh I didn't know that `__foo` actually did something specific. Still: I don't think _anything_ should be private. If an advanced user want's to subclass and change behaviour, let the,

@ashb I agree, I just take literally what @dimberman wanted as he would like this as `private` helper, which I took very literally ;).

Thanks for hard work, and a lot of those code review. It was a really good experience for me, although a little longer than expected ;). Again thank You!
